title: Talobilla Park
text:
Talobilla Park is a sporting facility located in the suburb of <a href="Kippa-Ring%2C%20Queensland">Kippa-Ring, Queensland</a> in <a href="Australia">Australia</a>. Sports include <a href="baseball">baseball</a>, <a href="canoeing">canoeing</a>, <a href="dragon%20boat">dragon boat</a>ing, <a href="Association%20football">Association football</a>, <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> and <a href="softball">softball</a>. Talobilla Park also contains an <a href="Automated%20Weather%20Observing%20System">Automated Weather Observing System</a> for the Australian Bureau of Meteorology. It is built on an old <a href="landfill">landfill</a> reserve.
Baseball.
Talobilla has two regulation-size baseball diamonds built in 2004 including one regulation <a href="Little%20League">Little League</a> field. The main diamond is a fully fenced and regulation-sized baseball field with field-level <a href="dugout%20%28baseball%29">dugouts</a>, two <a href="bullpen">bullpen</a>s, two battery cages, a scorers box, <a href="Canteen%20%28place%29">canteen</a>, <a href="bar%20%28establishment%29">bar</a> and shaded seating for approx 100.
Major A standard <a href="Floodlights%20%28sport%29">floodlighting</a> and a second amenities block with an umpires change room and showers has also been proposed by the <a href="Moreton%20Bay%20Regional%20Council">Moreton Bay Regional Council</a> and will be completed before the 2010 season.
Diamond two is also a regulation-sized baseball diamond with training standard <a href="Floodlights%20%28sport%29">floodlighting</a>. It is home to the <a href="Redcliffe%20Padres">Redcliffe Padres</a>, the largest baseball club in <a href="Queensland">Queensland</a> and second largest in <a href="Australia">Australia</a>. It has hosted a variety of events including <a href="Queensland">Queensland</a> schoolboys and club junior state titles.
